--- CONTEXT & REQUIREMENTS (follow exactly) ---
Use-case: news-style explainer for a general audience on deadline.
Format requirements:
- Headline (one line, compelling).
- Deck: exactly 2 sentences summarizing the key points.
- 3 sections with clear subheadings.
- Include exactly 2 short direct quotes in double quotes (attributed to named sources).
- End with 1 forward-looking perspective sentence.

--- LENGTH (important) ---
Target length: 50 words (plus or minus 15%).

--- TONE / STYLE GUIDE ---
Tone: neutral, informative, straightforward. Avoid metaphors, theatrics, and flowery language. Focus on clarity and precision.

--- OUTPUT RULES (strict) ---
- Write the deliverable in English.
- Output ONLY the final content (no preface, no commentary, no explanations).
- Follow all required structure and counts exactly (sections, labels, number of items, timestamps, etc.).
- If you're unsure about a specific detail, keep it high-level or phrase it cautiously rather than guessing.

(Do a quick silent self-check before sending: structure ✓ counts ✓ length ✓)
claim: The anthology aired during the twentieth season.
sentence: It aired during the twentieth season.
title: Treehouse of Horror XIX
